ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin manifestatio, from manifestare 'to manifest', from manifestus 'obvious'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The act or process of becoming visible or evident; a clear display or showing of something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某事物显现或变得明显的过程或行为；清晰的展示或表现。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The widespread protests were a clear manifestation of public discontent.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这些广泛的抗议是公众不满的明确表现。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An embodiment or physical form of something abstract; a symptom or sign.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 抽象事物的具体体现或物理形式；症状或迹象。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The rash was a manifestation of an allergic reaction.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 皮疹是过敏反应的一种表现形式。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The appearance of a ghost or spirit; a materialization.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 鬼魂或灵魂的显形或出现；实体现形。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Local folklore tells of a spectral manifestation in the old mansion.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 当地民间传说讲述了老宅中幽灵的显现。

REGISTER: Formal to semi-formal; used in academic, spiritual, and general contexts.
